name: Community Development and Social Change
description: Explores the significance of community development as a social change strategy, through a critical social analysis of local and global case studies and policies. Note: This is a joint graduate/undergraduate course.
prerequisites: NEW240Y1, NEW346H1, and an additional 0.5 Equity Studies Core Group 300+ level course. Students must have completed 14.0 credits, be enrolled in the Equity Studies Major Program, and will normally have a CGPA of at least 3.5. Enrolment is by application. Consult the Program Office (nc.undergradadmin@utoronto.ca or 416-978-5404) for course enrolment procedures.
